trans-unit.source:
\n

Listens to the file system change notifications and raises events when a directory, or file in a directory, changes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx x xxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The directory to monitor, in standard or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) notation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxxxx Xxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx $XXX$ xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The path parameter is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source: path is too long.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxx$$xx$ xx xxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The directory to monitor, in standard or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) notation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxxxx Xxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx $XXX$ xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The path parameter is null.

-or-

The filter parameter is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x$x$$xx$ $$x$$x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source: path is too long.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxx$$xx$ xx xxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the component is enabled.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue if the component is enabled; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source: The default is false.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
If you are using the component on a designer in Visual Studio 2005, the default is true.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxx Xxxxxx 0000$ xxx xxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current operating system is not Microsoft Windows NT or later.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx Xxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx XX xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the filter string used to determine what files are monitored in a directory.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets a value indicating whether subdirectories within the specified path should be monitored.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue if you want to monitor subdirectories; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
The default is false.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the size (in bytes) of the internal buffer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxx $xx xxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The internal buffer size in bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The default is 8192 (8 KB).

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx xx 0000 $0 XX$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the type of changes to watch for.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The value that is being set is not valid.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xxx xx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the path of the directory to watch.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
The specified path does not exist or could not be found.

-or-

The specified path contains wildcard characters.

-or-

The specified path contains invalid path characters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$ $$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$ $$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A synchronous method that returns a structure that contains specific information on the change that occurred, given the type of change you want to monitor.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A synchronous method that returns a structure that contains specific information on the change that occurred, given the type of change you want to monitor and the time (in milliseconds) to wait before timing out.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx $xx xxxxxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The time (in milliseconds) to wait before timing out.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx $xx xxxxxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx.

trans-unit.source: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x
